intro: Angolluma gilbertii, commonly known as the Gilbert's angolluma, is a rare flowering plant native to the arid regions of central Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered white flowers and leathery, evergreen leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to withstand prolonged droughts. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
